definition: to lease out/to rent (one's property out to sb else)
to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])

sentences.english: News of the leases leaked out at once.
Businesses that needed to lease space took advantage of the market weakness to extract concessions out of landlords.
sentences.chinese: 有租赁需要的商行利用市场疲软吸纳房东的租让。

definition: unequal treaty of 1898 whereby the Qing dynasty ceded the lease of Lüshun (Port Arthur) to Russia
pinyin: Lu:3 Da4 Zu1 di4 Tiao2 yue1

definition: to rent out one's land (to tenant farmers)
diplomatic immunity/(history) extraterritoriality, the rights (under unequal treaties) of a foreigner to live in China outside Chinese jurisdiction
Treaty of Aigun, 1858 unequal treaty forced on Qing China by Tsarist Russia
